title: Cratylus by Plato
description: Cratylus (ΚΡΑΤΥΛΟΣ) discusses whether things have names by mere convention or have true names which can only be correctly applied to the object named and may have originated from God. Painting: Oedipus and the Sphinx by Gustave Moreau. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Audiobook read by Geoffrey Edwards.
content:encoded: Cratylus (ΚΡΑΤΥΛΟΣ) discusses whether things have names by mere convention or have true names which can only be correctly applied to the object named and may have originated from God. Painting: Oedipus and the Sphinx by Gustave Moreau. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Audiobook read by Geoffrey Edwards.
itunes:subtitle: Cratylus (ΚΡΑΤΥΛΟΣ), Hermogenes and Socrates (ΣΩΚΡΑΤΗΣ) discuss the linguistic problem of whether there is a divine language whose words can only be properly assigned to the objects they name.
